bibl.title: William Spears and James McGough v King County. Writ Granted.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: HG Thomton James Seavey James Fleass

div1.ab: In the District Court Holding Terms at Seattle, Wash. Ter.
The People of the United States of America to the H.G. Thomton a Constable of King County Greeting,
div1.p: We command you, that you have the bodies of William Spears, James McGough by you imprisoned and detained as it is said together eith the time and cause of such imprisionment and detention by whatsoever name said William Spears and James McGough shall be called, or charged, before the Hon. Roger S. Greene, Judge of the aforesaid County at for Courtroom of the above entitled leave forthwith to do and recieve whall shall then and there be considered concerning the said William Spears and the said James McGough And have you then and there this Writ.
div1.ab: Witness the Hon. Roger S. Greene. Judge of said District Court and the Seal threat this 9th day of Nov. AD 1883
James Seavey Clerk By James F. Cass Deputy.
